results.title: Marine erosion processes: Cliffed coasts
results.brief_description: Illustrates the major processes at work in shaping cliffs, using a wide variety of examples from along the South Coast of NSW and several animated diagrams. Covers wave attack, subaerial weathering; type and structure of rock; the topography of the coastal margin; and the effects of past climate and changing levels of land and sea.

results.title: Marine animals and their foods
results.brief_description: The inter-relation of marine animals and their surroundings is demonstrated by showing various sea animals and the five general types of foods on which they depend. Marine animals illustrated include the sea anemone, the sea urchin, the barnacle, and the octopus. Types of foods include diatoms, plankton, debris, detritus, seaweed, and other animals. Mentions is made of the specific adaptations of marine animals for obtaining one or more of the main types of food.

results.brief_description: Marilyn Townsend shows the viewer some aspects of machine embroidery including design, stitching, embroidery, quilting and applique.

results.title: Marilyn Monroe: beyond the legend
results.brief_description: This documentary narrated by Richard Widmark, is a tribute to the legendary actress. Numerous film clips range from her earliest appearances in “Dangerous Years” and “All About Eve”, to her triumphant performance in “Bus Stop” and “The Misfits”. The film also features a wealth of rare archival and newsreel footage, as well as in depth interviews with colleagues and friends.

results.title: Marijuana: the great escape
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A discussion of the effects of marijuana and the forces acting to encourage the use the drugs amongst young people. Focuses on George whose major interest in drag racing and a girl named Pat. He is successful as a racer and his relationship with Pat is a happy one. George uses marijuana regularly and tries to persuade Pat to become a user. Their experiences provide a useful starting point for the discussion.

results.title: Marijuana
results.brief_description: Here, a somnolent Sonny Bono appears as the friendly face of commercial interests. This document is one of a series of reactionary films against drug use and the toning down of 1960’s youth culture. A dramatised examination of the “facts” relating to marijuana. Contrasts the use of marijuana, alcohol and other drugs. Points out that some people can develop a psychological dependence, and that the laws of the country are designed to protect both the individual and the society. [Ignores established and medical fact that cannabis was freely grown and consumed, and indeed providing the principle source of paper pulp in the U.S. until the Harris Narcotics Act of 1937]. Music by Gene Clarke.

results.title: Marigoli
results.creator_credit: Sandra Nichols and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Looks at Marigoli, a village area of equatorial Africa, and the problems caused by a rapidly expanding population. There is reluctance by the women to use birth control, because of the expectancy of a high mortality rate amongst their children. Food was once plentiful, but is now scarce due to the rapid expansion of population and the reduction of arable land. Also looks at the expense of education for children.

results.title: Maria Callas: debut a Paris, 19 decembre, 1958
results.creator_credit: Roger Benamon, EMI/Parlophone and INA France
results.brief_description: In 1958 Maria Callas made her Paris debut in a gala performance in front of the President and the elite of Parisian society. She sings arias and scenes from “La Forza del destino” and “Il Trovatore” by Verdi, “Norma” by Bellini, “Il Barbiere di Siviglia” by Rossini and “Tosca” by Puccini. Tito Gobbi, Albert Lance, Louis Riallan and Jean Paul Hurteau accompany her and the Orchestre et Choeurs du Theatre National de l’Opera de Paris is conducted by Georges Sebastian. The brief commentary is in French and there are no subtitles.

results.title: Maria Callas in concert: Hamburg, 18 May, 1959 and 16 March, 1962
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone and NDR International TV-Produktions GmbH
results.brief_description: Presenting excerpts from two live stage performances by the famed diva opera singer, Maria Callas, in Hamburg in 1959 and 1962 respectively. This video is an absolute must for lovers of opera combining the musical talents of such composers as Verdi, Bizet, Rossini and Bellini, and all superbly performed by the wonderful Maria Callas, elegant as ever with her distinctive soprano voice and dramatic intensity totally captivating the audience. Her performance is accompanied by the Symphonieorchester des NDR, conducted by Nicola Rescigno (1959) and Georges Pretre (1962). Without commentary or narration.

results.title: Margot Fonteyn
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Patricia Foy, Antelope Films and Aurora Productions
results.brief_description: Margot Fonteyn is one of the most loved ballerinas of all time. This documentary, made on the eve of her seventieth birthday is an intimate exploration of both her professional and personal life. The four most significant figures in her career, Ninette de Valois, Frederick Ashton, Robert Helpmann and Rudolf Nureyev contribute their memories. Filmed at her home in Panama, the program features excerpts from some of her greatest roles.
